long_term.title: WisdomTree launches new Bitcoin exchange-traded product
long_term.summary: WisdomTree Europe has launched a physically-backed Bitcoin exchange-traded product (ETP) on the SIX Swiss Exchange. This product aims to provide easier access for institutional investors by allowing them to speculate on Bitcoin without directly holding the asset. Each investor is entitled to a certain amount of Bitcoin relative to their investment.
long_term.rationale: The launch of a physically-backed Bitcoin ETP by a reputable firm like WisdomTree signals increasing institutional interest and provides a regulated avenue for investment. This can lead to greater capital inflows and broader adoption.

long_term.title: Bitcoin: Big Market Shift Dead Ahead
long_term.summary: The article highlights the upcoming Bitcoin halving event in May 2020, which will reduce the new supply of Bitcoin by 50%. This event is described as an immediate, inevitable, and irreversible reduction in new supply, historically correlated with significant market shifts.
long_term.rationale: The Bitcoin halving is a fundamental supply-side event that has historically preceded significant price increases. The reduction in new supply, coupled with consistent or growing demand, creates upward price pressure.

long_term.title: Jack Dorsey’s Square Wins Patent for Fiat-to-Crypto Payments Network
long_term.summary: Payments provider Square has secured a U.S. patent for a network enabling seamless crypto-to-fiat transactions. This system allows users to transact with each other in real-time, with the network automatically exchanging the sender's payment into the asset specified by the receiver.
long_term.rationale: This patent represents a significant step towards simplifying fiat-to-crypto conversions, potentially lowering barriers to entry for mainstream users. Improved payment infrastructure can drive broader adoption and utility for Bitcoin.

long_term.title: Fidelity Exec Predicts Crypto Custodians Will White-Label Their Services
long_term.summary: A Fidelity Digital Assets executive predicts that crypto custodians will increasingly offer white-label services, allowing other firms to store cryptocurrency for their clients. This model is seen as more cost-effective than building proprietary infrastructure.
long_term.rationale: The trend towards white-labeling custody solutions indicates a maturing market for institutional crypto services. This can lead to increased participation from traditional financial institutions, boosting liquidity and legitimacy.

long_term.title: SEC gives green light to Bitcoin futures fund
long_term.summary: The U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) has approved an investment fund that will invest in cash-settled Bitcoin futures. Managed by Stone Ridge Funds, this move is seen as a positive step for regulated Bitcoin investment products.
long_term.rationale: SEC approval for a Bitcoin futures fund signifies regulatory acceptance and provides a more accessible, regulated investment vehicle for a broader range of investors, potentially increasing demand.

long_term.title: Square Crypto offers grant to pseudonymous Bitcoin developer
long_term.summary: Square Crypto has awarded a grant to a Lightning Network developer, 'ZmnSCPxj', to support their work. This funding aims to enable the developer to focus on Lightning and Bitcoin development full-time, fostering innovation in the ecosystem.
long_term.rationale: Support for core protocol development, particularly for the Lightning Network, is crucial for improving Bitcoin's scalability and transaction efficiency. Increased development can lead to better user experience and wider adoption.

long_term.title: HTC’s Binance edition smartphone going on sale tomorrow; supports bitcoin, BNB payments
long_term.summary: HTC's Binance edition smartphone, supporting Bitcoin and BNB payments, is going on sale. Priced at $599, it offers an early adopter bonus of $100 in BNB for the first 500 purchasers. This initiative aims to integrate crypto into everyday consumer electronics.
long_term.rationale: While niche, the integration of crypto payments into consumer electronics like smartphones represents a step towards broader adoption and utility. It normalizes crypto usage for everyday transactions.

long_term.title: Simon Malls Has 5 New Bitcoin ATMs With Bitstop Partnership
long_term.summary: Bitstop is installing five Bitcoin ATMs in Simon Property Group malls across the U.S. This partnership expands the company's reach to first-time Bitcoin users in high-traffic retail locations, targeting the growing crypto ATM market.
long_term.rationale: Increased accessibility through Bitcoin ATMs in prominent retail locations can drive adoption among new users. This expansion of physical infrastructure supports the growing demand for easy on-ramps.

long_term.title: The Central Bank Business Model Is Under Attack
long_term.summary: The article discusses the increasing regulation in the crypto sector during 2019 and the growing interest from governments in blockchain technology. It notes that while China banned ICOs, it also promoted blockchain technology.
long_term.rationale: The evolving regulatory landscape and central banks' exploration of digital currencies present both opportunities and challenges. Increased regulation can legitimize the space but also stifle innovation if not implemented thoughtfully.

long_term.title: Gemini now provides crypto’s largest insurance coverage
long_term.summary: Gemini Trust Company LLC, a regulated cryptocurrency exchange and custodian, has announced it provides the largest insurance coverage in the crypto industry. This move enhances security and trust for users and institutional investors.
long_term.rationale: Enhanced security through substantial insurance coverage is critical for attracting institutional capital and building broader trust in crypto exchanges and custodians. This can lead to increased trading volumes and asset inflows.

short_term.title: The Crypto Daily – Movers and Shakers – 26/01/20
short_term.summary: Bitcoin fell 1.11% on Saturday, ending the day at $8,353.7. A bearish start saw it slide from $8,447.2 to $8,280.0, breaking the first major support level at $8,287.73 before recovering slightly. The near-term bearish trend remains intact.
short_term.rationale: The price action on Saturday shows a clear break of support and continuation of a near-term bearish trend, suggesting potential for further downside in the immediate days.

short_term.title: The Crypto Daily – Movers and Shakers – 26/01/20
short_term.summary: Bitcoin fell 1.11% on Saturday, ending the day at $8,353.7. A bearish start saw it slide from $8,447.2 to $8,280.0, breaking the first major support level at $8,287.73 before recovering slightly. The near-term bearish trend remains intact.
short_term.rationale: The bearish sentiment and broken support level from Saturday could continue to weigh on Bitcoin's price in the coming week, especially if no significant positive catalysts emerge.

short_term.title: ETF Fee War Hits ESG, Active Mgmt
short_term.summary: The ETF market is experiencing a fee war driven by investor demand for lower costs. This trend impacts all strategies, including actively managed and ESG funds, forcing asset managers to adapt by lowering fees to attract assets.
short_term.rationale: While not directly about Bitcoin ETFs, the broader ETF fee war could influence how future crypto ETFs are priced, potentially impacting inflows and overall market sentiment towards regulated crypto products.

short_term.title: ETF Fee War Hits ESG, Active Mgmt
short_term.summary: The ETF market is experiencing a fee war driven by investor demand for lower costs. This trend impacts all strategies, including actively managed and ESG funds, forcing asset managers to adapt by lowering fees to attract assets.
short_term.rationale: The ongoing fee compression in the ETF market might indirectly influence the cost structure and competitiveness of any potential Bitcoin ETFs, impacting their attractiveness to investors in the short term.

short_term.title: Blockchain interoperability will be key to successful projects this year
short_term.summary: Blockchain interoperability is crucial for mass adoption, enabling information sharing across networks. Many projects remain siloed, hindering the industry's potential. New organizations are emerging to facilitate cross-network interaction.
short_term.rationale: Developments in blockchain interoperability, while not directly impacting Bitcoin's price in the short term, contribute to a healthier and more connected crypto ecosystem, which is a positive long-term signal.

short_term.title: Blockchain interoperability will be key to successful projects this year
short_term.summary: Blockchain interoperability is crucial for mass adoption, enabling information sharing across networks. Many projects remain siloed, hindering the industry's potential. New organizations are emerging to facilitate cross-network interaction.
short_term.rationale: The emphasis on interoperability suggests a growing focus on building a more integrated blockchain landscape, which could indirectly benefit Bitcoin by fostering broader crypto adoption.

short_term.title: Just because your FICO credit score is high doesn't mean you should start borrowing
short_term.summary: Fair Isaac is changing how FICO scores are calculated, potentially affecting loan approvals. These changes aim to help consumers manage economic downturns better. The article discusses the implications of these credit score shifts.
short_term.rationale: Changes in credit scoring could indirectly affect consumer spending power and risk appetite, which might have a minor, indirect impact on speculative asset markets like Bitcoin.

short_term.title: Just because your FICO credit score is high doesn't mean you should start borrowing
short_term.summary: Fair Isaac is changing how FICO scores are calculated, potentially affecting loan approvals. These changes aim to help consumers manage economic downturns better. The article discusses the implications of these credit score shifts.
short_term.rationale: The immediate impact of FICO score changes on broader economic sentiment or consumer borrowing habits is likely to be minimal within a 7-day window.

short_term.title: Poloniex Drops KYC for Withdrawals Below $10,000 Following US Exit
short_term.summary: Poloniex has introduced 'Level 1' accounts allowing withdrawals up to $10,000 daily without KYC verification, requiring only an email and password. This change follows its exit from the U.S. market.
short_term.rationale: The relaxation of KYC requirements on Poloniex could potentially increase liquidity on the exchange for certain user segments, but its impact on overall market dynamics is likely to be limited given its US exit.

short_term.title: Bitcoin, Ethereum & Litecoin - American Wrap: 1/2/20
short_term.summary: Bitcoin broke below $7,000 on heavy selling volume, trading under its 55 and 200-day EMAs, and making lower highs and lows. Ethereum also shows vulnerability to further downside risks.
short_term.rationale: The technical breakdown for Bitcoin and Ethereum, with prices trading below key EMAs and showing bearish trends, suggests continued downward pressure in the immediate short term.

daily_view.summary: Bitcoin experienced a bearish day on Saturday, breaking key support levels and reinforcing a near-term downtrend. While the broader market sentiment remains cautious, long-term developments like WisdomTree's ETP launch and Square's patent for fiat-to-crypto payments continue to signal institutional interest and infrastructure improvements. The upcoming Bitcoin halving remains a significant bullish catalyst on the horizon.
key_risks: Continued bearish price action and breakdown of key technical levels.
Lack of immediate positive catalysts to counter selling pressure.
Potential for broader macroeconomic downturn impacting risk assets.
Liquidity concerns if major exchanges face issues.
watch_items: Bitcoin's price action around the $8,000 support level.
Developments related to the upcoming Bitcoin halving.
Any news regarding institutional Bitcoin ETF applications or approvals.
Macroeconomic data releases impacting global markets.
Hash rate trends and mining difficulty adjustments.
